title: China to launch lunar navigation and communications test satellites
summary: China is preparing to launch a pair of Tiandu lunar experimental technology satellites for a planned constellation of satellites to support lunar exploration.

title: Space industry urged to take a broader view of sustainability
summary: The space industry need to take a broader examination of issues related to space sustainability that go beyond preventing the growth of space debris, one official says.

title: ESA Boosts Deep-Space Comms Capacity with Cryocooled Upgrade
summary:
The European Space Agency’s deep-space communications station in Spain has been upgraded, boosting its download capacity. Deep space networks are facing an unprecedented demand for communication bandwidth from space agencies around the world and, increasingly, from private companies. One of the ways that ESA is working to meet this demand is by adding a fourth […]
The post ESA Boosts Deep-Space Comms Capacity with Cryocooled Upgrade appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Viasat preparing to start services from hobbled ViaSat-3 satellite
summary: Viasat expects to start providing Wi-Fi to planes by the end of June from ViaSat-3 F1, the satellite that lost more than 90% of its 1 terabit per second capacity after an antenna deployment failure last year.

title: Venture-backed space companies face “year of reckoning”
summary: The aftermath of a “bubble” of investment in space startups in recent years could cause many companies to struggle to raise additional funding even as overall market conditions improve.
